data.title: Application window is stuck on top of other apps on Ubuntu 16 + VirtualBox(3D Accelerated)

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: Ubuntu16 (Running on VirtualBox 5.0.20 + 3D acceleration)

On Ubuntu16, vscode window will be stuck on top of all other windows - even above it's own menu, dialog, etc.. When I minimize the app, the main window will be left open but I can not interact with it. 

I've also noticed that the vscode app window's refresh rate is super slow; when I move the window around the desktop by grabbing the title bar, the main window sluggishly follows the title bar which is refreshed more responsively. 

I am not seeing any issue with Ubuntu 14, however.

_update_
If I disable 3D acceleration on the VirtualBox, the issue goes away. Also, google-chrome and chromium browser also has a similar issue. I believe this issue has to do with Chrome browser and VirtualBox-3D acceleration.

data.title: git integration - Permission Denied (publickey)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: Win 7

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Clone a repository
2. Attempt any git action against the remote from Code (fetch, pull, push)

Works fine from windows cli, git gui, etc

Full detail here
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/37103047

Is this buggy behavior?

data.title: DecorationRenderOptions / createTextEditorDecorationType doesn't support fontWeight?
Ignoring tsconfig.json in Angular 2 CLI generated apps
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

Maybe it's a problem with the project setup, but VSCode doesn't honor the experimentalDecorators flag and other tsconfig settings for any file you open AFTER the first file in an Angular CLI generated project.  You can close all files and wait a second and then open the files in a different order and the ones reporting errors will switch.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install angular 2 cli from NPM
2. use "ng new test" to create a new project.
3. Open the created directory in code.  The first TS file you open won't have any problems but all the ones you open after that won't use the tsconfig.json.
![code-ng2-bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/291462/15098770/dfde08a2-1512-11e6-8d05-deaaab3d34cd.gif)

data.title: Error Run 'Debug: Download .NETCore Debugger' in the Command Palette or open a .NET project directory to download the .NETCore Debugger
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: 10.11.4

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Using dotnet new to create a simple HelloWorld.cs program. 
2. dotnet restore and dotnet run to check if the program can run without an errors (optional)
3. Put a breakpoint and hit cmd + f5. 

After following the steps above, I get the error: 
Error Run 'Debug: Download .NETCore Debugger' in the Command Palette or open a .NET project directory to download the .NETCore Debugger

$ dotnet --version
.NET Command Line Tools (1.0.0-beta-001598)

Product Information:
 Version:     1.0.0-beta-001598
 Commit Sha:  7582649f88

Runtime Environment:
 OS Name:     Mac OS X
 OS Version:  10.11
 OS Platform: Darwin
 Runtime Id:  osx.10.11-x64

Strange part is I already have the .NETCore Debugger installed. It keeps asking me to open project.json
Is there any other information that I could share here to help you guys figure this out? This is the first issue I am opening. Thanks.

data.title: Keyboard shortcut for copy of line doesn't work on Linux
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04 LTS

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Click into a text line
2. Press `Ctrl + Shift + Alt + UpArrow` or `Ctrl + Shift + Alt + DownArrow`

Expected result:
- line is duplicated up/down

Actual result:
- nothing happens

Workaround:
- run the command from the command palette

data.title: VSCode is not per monitor DPI aware
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Connect second monitor and adjust DPI such as the second monitor has different DPI than the main one
2. Drag Vscode window to the second monitor - UI becomes all blurry.

Possibly related to #1896 and also this upstream Chromium issue: https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=426656

data.title: Folding in XML files doesn't work properly
data.body:
I'm not sure if it's relevant, but apparently this happens in Atom too atom/atom#3442
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0 (Commit fa6d0f0)
- OS Version: Windows 8 Pro

Steps to Reproduce:
- create a new file 
- select XML language mode
- use this text:

``` xml
<foo>
    <bar>
        <baz/>
    <baz>
        blah blah blah
    </baz>
    </bar>
</foo>
```
- try to fold the `<bar>` element on line 2

user settings (minus `git.path`, because I _hope_ that doesn't affect code folding):

``` json
// Place your settings in this file to overwrite the default settings
{
    "editor.tabSize": 2,
    "editor.insertSpaces": false,
    "files.eol": "\n",
    "files.trimTrailingWhitespace": true,
    "files.autoSave": "afterDelay",
    "files.autoSaveDelay": 60000
}
```

data.title: Bug: Font error when i change font size to 14
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install Droid Sans Mono font
2. Open workspace preference
3. put these setting in the file
   "editor.fontFamily": "Droid Sans Mono",
   "editor.fontSize": 14
4. this happen

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10234339/15096217/f4bb9ea4-1519-11e6-823e-c2472ff7696c.png)

VSCode works fine with other font size but 14

data.title: Question: Is there a way to hide the .vscode folder?
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a new project.
2. Wait until the folder appears.

So yeah, it is only that. I find it a bit annoying. But I know it might be useful.

data.title: Improve OutputChannel API (discovery, appending, etc)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0-insider
- OS Version: Win10

I understand how to create and use a new `OutputChannel` ...

``` typescript
var tasksOutputChannel = new OutputChannel;
tasksOutputChannel.addOutputChannel('Status Bar Tasks');
```

... but since my extension is working with tasks, it would be better if I could get a ref to the existing `Tasks` output channel and write my messages there.

I don't see a method for this. Is there any way to get such a reference to an existing output channel?

data.title: please add enable emmet expand abbreviations in customlanguage
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: Windows

I love this editor. it's awesome, very fast response, open, edit.
but it's not support emmet expand abbreviations in custom syntax eg .blade, .vue 

 i try to add "files.associations": {"*.blade.php": "html"}, emmet work but my extension blade syntax hilighting not working. if it's can work together i think my heart is got by vscode :+1: 

if next release has settings about enable emmet expand abbreviations in settings.json or other place.
i think it's wonderful text editor in this world.

Best regard

ps. sorry for my bad english

data.title: emmet.triggerExpansionOnTab php variables to html tags
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0-insider
- OS Version: Manjaro 15.12 x64

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a variable in php called `$variable`.
2. Then press tab and it'll be replaced by `<1variable></1variable>`.

I don't know if it's a bug but it's not what I was expecting.

data.title: I am unable to press "Shift+Alt+A" to toggle a block comment

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.0.0.
- OS Version:Win 10 Pro build 14322

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Highlight a block of text
2. Press `Shift+Alt+A`. Nothing happens. (however, via the `Ctrl+P` menu and select togel clock comment, as is OK)
3. In the Keybinding,json Shot cuts file, I see:

```
{ "key": "shift+alt+a",           "command": "editor.action.blockComment",
                                     "when": "editorTextFocus" },
```

And nothing is overridden in my user settings.

data.title: Unable to search for ^.*(regex).*$ in full text search until file is opened

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: Win 10 Pro

Steps to Reproduce:
1. close all file are opened in vsc editor
2. close vscode than open it again
3. search for `^.*(regex).*$`
4. no results
5. open an editor that contains `regex`
6. run search again

=> now you find results

2. Open the find box and check the regular expression button.

data.title: failed crash dump on exit in Linux when `wget` not installed
data.body:

> Version 1.0.0
> Commit fa6d0f03813dfb9df4589c30121e9fcffa8a8ec8
> Date 2016-04-13T14:21:33.326Z
> Shell 0.35.6
> Renderer 45.0.2454.85
> Node 4.1.1
- OS Version `cat /proc/version`:

> Linux version 4.5.1-1-ARCH (builduser@tobias) (gcc version 5.3.0 (GCC) ) #1 SMP PREEMPT Thu Apr 14 19:19:32 CEST 2016

Steps to Reproduce:
1. launch `code` via terminal
2. close VSCode via new GUI window that appears
3. observe (not always, but maybe first time per day?) 

> Cannot upload crash dump: cannot exec /usr/bin/wget
> Failed to get crash dump id.
> Report Id:

data.title: VScode unable to recognize whether JShint extension is installed or not.
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.1.0-alpha
- OS Version: Windows10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch app and try to install JShint extension.
2. Verify user should get success message. 
3. Click on reload and verify from the installed extensions list.

Actual: I observed JShint extension is showing up in extension install and installed list.
Expected:
1. if there is no update for the extension then it should not display under install list.
2. If extension is not installed then it should not display in the installed extensions list.
Error message:
![Uploading image.png]()

![jshintextensionshowingboththeplaces](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/15089682/2270af04-13be-11e6-946e-82f085977830.gif)

data.title: Rename Symbol not translated
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0-alpha
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Change language to non-english
2. Right click > observe Rename Symbol is not translated
3. F1 palette 'Rename Symbol' is also not translated 

Looks like a regression as it is translated in 1.1.0 insiders.

data.title: No cloring for fields type in typescript interface.
data.body:
This issue might be related to: https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript-TmLanguage/issues/44
There is no coloring for interface field types when user select Light (Visual Studio) there in VSCode.
When I am changing the theme then types are highlighted properly so it is just a matter with Light (Visual studio) theme.

![interfacecoloringissue](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/15087813/50abc0c4-13a1-11e6-8c00-61d039a5aed7.gif)

data.title: Required extensions in workspace settings

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
I would like to have a required extensions section in settings.json of my workspace. These extensions should be automatically installed when a project is opened the first time or a warning message should be shown that required extensions are missing. 
At the moment I need to instruct my team to install specific extensions to work on a shared project. It would be nice to automate this process.

milestone.title: Backlog

data.body:

2. open the directory in Code

The command window will indicate it's working for a few seconds, but nothing will happen.

data.title: [css] Go to/Peek Definition and Find all References in CSS
data.body:

- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a css file
2. Right click to show context menu

Shows grayed out Go to Definition, Peek Definition and Find all References:

![contextmenucss](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12900364/15085620/3201b1ee-1390-11e6-8af7-2a7c0829d675.PNG)

Other file types that do not support them, they are not included in the right click context menu. Are they included here for some other reason?

data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.00
- OS Version:Windowns7 64bt

   [testpy.zip](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/252680/testpy.zip)
2. assuming there is a line change between "hello"s, for example , if I run in command window, or other python IDE, I would see output like this :
   ![expected_output](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13721617/15079955/6d4e1578-1370-11e6-8d2b-aec1272d8df9.PNG)

However , if I run this test.py in vscode python , I can't see empty lines between "hello"s , wondering any thing I missing in the setting file?

Jack
